intro: Lampranthus alpinus, commonly known as the Alpine ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces showy, star-shaped flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange, typically during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in arid conditions.
